intro: Myosurus lepturus, commonly known as the slender water scurvygrass, is a small, herbaceous annual plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hairless stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically borne on slender, branching stalks. It thrives in wet, marshy habitats and is often found in coastal areas or along the edges of ponds and streams. Myosurus lepturus is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed soils, making it an important pioneer species in wetland ecosystems.
